# OpInterface definitions
## AlignedChannelsOpInterface (`IE_AlignedChannelsOpInterface`)

Interface for operations that require channel alignment
### Methods:
#### `verifyChannels`

```c++
mlir::LogicalResult verifyChannels();
```
Verify channel alignement
NOTE: This method *must* be implemented by the user.

#### `getChannelAlignment`

```c++
int64_t getChannelAlignment();
```
Get channel alignement factor in elements
NOTE: This method *must* be implemented by the user.

## LayerOpInterface (`IE_LayerOpInterface`)

Base interface for IE Layer Operation
### Methods:
#### `getInputs`

```c++
mlir::OperandRange getInputs();
```
Get all layer input tensors
NOTE: This method *must* be implemented by the user.

#### `getOutputs`

```c++
mlir::ResultRange getOutputs();
```
Get all layer output tensors
NOTE: This method *must* be implemented by the user.

## LayerWithPostOpInterface (`IE_LayerWithPostOpInterface`)

Interface for operations that support post-processing
### Methods:
#### `getPostOp`

```c++
llvm::Optional<mlir::OperationName> getPostOp();
```
Get the post-processing operation
NOTE: This method *must* be implemented by the user.

#### `getPostOpAttrs`

```c++
mlir::DictionaryAttr getPostOpAttrs();
```
Get the post-processing operation attributes
NOTE: This method *must* be implemented by the user.

#### `setPostOp`

```c++
void setPostOp(mlir::Operation*postOp);
```
Set post-processing operation attribute
NOTE: This method *must* be implemented by the user.

#### `isSupportedPostOp`

```c++
bool isSupportedPostOp(mlir::Operation*postOp);
```
Set post-processing operation attribute
NOTE: This method *must* be implemented by the user.

## LayoutInfoOpInterface (`IE_LayoutInfoOpInterface`)

Interface for operations to provide information about supported layout for inputs/outputs
### Methods:
#### `inferLayoutInfo`

```c++
void inferLayoutInfo(vpux::IE::LayerLayoutInfo&info);
```
Infer supported Data Layouts from inputs to outputs or describe the supported combination
NOTE: This method *must* be implemented by the user.

#### `getLayoutInfo`

```c++
vpux::IE::LayerLayoutInfo getLayoutInfo();
```
Get information about current layout for Layer inputs and outputs
NOTE: This method *must* be implemented by the user.
